de.topicmapslab.tmql4j.grammar.productions
Interface IExpression

All Known Implementing Classes:
AKOExpression, Anchor, AssociationPattern, BindingSet, BooleanExpression, BooleanExpression, BooleanFilter, BooleanPrimitive, ComparisonExpression, Content, Content, DateLiteral, DateTimeLiteral, DecimalLiteral, DeleteClause, DeleteExpression, Directive, EnvironmentClause, EnvironmentClause, ExistsClause, ExistsQuantifiers, Expression, ExpressionImpl, Filter, FilterPostfix, FlwrExpression, ForAllClause, ForClause, FromClause, FunctionCall, FunctionInvocation, InsertClause, InsertExpression, IntegerLiteral, IriReference, ISAExpression, LimitClause, Literal, MergeExpression, Navigation, NonInterpretedContent, NonInterpretedContent, NumericalExpression, OffsetClause, OrderByClause, OrderByClause, ParameterPair, Parameters, PathExpression, PathExpression, PathSpecification, PathStep, Postfix, PostfixedExpression, Pragma, Pragma, PredicateInvocation, PredicateInvocation, PredicateInvocationRolePlayerExpression, PredicateInvocationRolePlayerExpression, PrefixDirective, PrefixDirective, ProjectionPostfix, QueryExpression, QueryExpression, QueryExpression, QueryExpression, QueryExpression, QueryExpression, QueryExpression, QueryExpression, ReturnClause, ScopeFilter, SelectClause, SelectExpression, SetExpression, SimpleContent, SimpleExpression, Step, StringLiteral, TimeLiteral, TMContent, TMContent, TopicDefinition, TupleExpression, UpdateClause, UpdateExpression, ValueExpression, ValueExpression, ValueExpression, Variable, Variable, VariableAssignment, WhereClause, WhereClause, WhereClause, WhereClause, WhereClause, WhereClause, XMLContent
public interface IExpression

Interface definition representing one specific production rule of the TMQL language draft. The expression also represent one node of the parsing-tree generated by the parser instance. The instance encapsulates all tokens containing to the production rule, all variables and provide utility functions to access information.

Author:
Sven Krosse

Method Detail

getExpressions

java.util.List<IExpression> getExpressions()
Method returns a list of all contained expression. Contained expressions will production rules which are part of the represented rule and interpreted as children nodes or leafs of the parsing tree.

Returns:
the list of contained expression

getTokens

java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTokens()
Method returns a list of string-represented tokens as a sub-set of the tokens generated by the lexical scanner. The list of tokens represent the whole sub-query of this production rule.

Returns:
a list of string-represented tokens

getTmqlTokens

java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends IToken>> getTmqlTokens()
Method returns a list of language-specific tokens as a sub-set of the tokens generated by the lexical scanner. The list of tokens represent the whole sub-query of this production rule.

Returns:
a list of language-specific tokens

getGrammarType

int getGrammarType()
In the current draft some production rules support different syntactical patterns and can be differ in grammar levels. The method return an identifier representing the grammar type at the context of the production rule.

Returns:
a numeric value representing the grammar type

setGrammarType

void setGrammarType(int type)
In the current draft some production rules support different syntactical patterns and can be differ in grammar levels. The method set the grammar type to the given numeric value.

Parameters:
type - a numeric value representing the grammar type

addExpression

void addExpression(IExpression ex)
Method add a new sub-tree to the production rule. The method normally calls during the initialization process of the production itself and during the parsing process. The method add a new sub-expression to the internal list.

Parameters:
ex - the new expression to add

getExpressionFilteredByType

<T extends IExpression> java.util.List<T> getExpressionFilteredByType(java.lang.Class<? extends T> type)
Method returns a sub-list of contained production rules filtered by a type. The type symbolize the production rule type the caller is interested in. Please note that at least an empty list will be returned and at most the result is equal to the method getExpressions().

Type Parameters:
T - the type parameter of expressions the caller is interested in
Parameters:
type - the type of expressions the caller is interested in
Returns:
a list of expressions of the given type which are included by the current instance

getParent

IExpression getParent()
Method returns the current parent node as part of the parsing tree. The parent instance will be set by calling the constructor and represent the production rule containing the expression represented by this instance.

Returns:
the parent expression. Please note that an instance of query-expression can return null if it is root-node of parsing tree.

getVariables

java.util.List<java.lang.String> getVariables()
Method extract all language-specific tokens which represents a variable token and transform them to their string-represented pattern.

Returns:
a list of all variables contained in the production rule

setExpressions

void setExpressions(java.util.List<IExpression> reorder)
                    throws TMQLRuntimeException
During the optimization process the contained expressions can be reorder by setting a new list of expression, which has to contain the same expressions like the old one but can be differ in order. Please note that this method can cause serious errors, if the re-ordered list contains absurd content.

Parameters:
reorder - the new order of contained expression
Throws:
TMQLRuntimeException - thrown if the given list does not contain the same elements like the old one

checkForExtensions

void checkForExtensions(java.lang.Class<? extends IExpression> clazz,
                        java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends IToken>> tmqlTokens,
                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> tokens,
                        ITMQLRuntime runtime)
                        throws TMQLInvalidSyntaxException,
                               TMQLGeneratorException
Method checks if there is an extension for the given expression type. If not the expression of this type will be created.

Parameters:
clazz - the expression type
tmqlTokens - the language-specific tokens
tokens - the string-represented tokens
runtime - the runtime
Throws:
TMQLInvalidSyntaxException - thrown by constructor
TMQLGeneratorException - thrown by constructor

interpret

QueryMatches interpret(ITMQLRuntime runtime,
                       IContext context,
                       java.lang.Object... optionalArguments)
                       throws TMQLRuntimeException
Method called to interpret the current expression.

Parameters:
runtime - the runtime
context - the context
optionalArguments - any optional arguments
Returns:
the matches for this expression
Throws:
TMQLRuntimeException - thrown if querying fails

isChildOf

boolean isChildOf(java.lang.Class<? extends IExpression> clazz)
Method checks if the current expression is a child of the specified expression type. The method walks up to the tree root and check all parent types.

Parameters:
clazz - the expression type
Returns:
true if the current expression is a child of the specified type, false otherwise.
